Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Noodle \Noo"dle\, n. [Cf. {Noddle}, {Noddy}.] 1. A simpleton; a blockhead; a stupid person; a ninny. [Low] [1913 Webster]
The chuckling grin of noodles. --Sydney Smith. [1913 Webster]
2. The head; also, {noddle}; -- used jocosely or contemptuously; as, use your noodle.
Syn: noggin. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Noodle \Noo"dle\, n. [G. nudel vermicelli.] A thin strip of dough, made with eggs, rolled up, cut into small pieces, and used in soup. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Noddle \Nod"dle\, n. [OE. nodil, nodle; perh. fr. nod, because the head is the nodding part of the body, or perh. akin to E. knot; cf. Prov. E. nod the nape of the neck.] 1. The head; also, {noodle}; -- used jocosely or contemptuously.
Syn: noggin. [1913 Webster +PJC]
Come, master, I have a project in my noddle. --L'Estrange. [1913 Webster]
2. The back part of the head or neck. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
For occasion . . . turneth a bald noddle, after she hath presented her locks in front, and no hold taken. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
noodle n 1: a ribbonlike strip of pasta 2: informal terms for a human head [syn: {attic}, {bean}, {bonce}, {noggin}, {dome}]
